title: Taylor Swift's Instagram Post Endorsing Kamala Harris Gets 9 Million 'Likes'
content: Soon after Kamala Harris finished debating her rival Donald Trump on Tuesday, Taylor Swift told her 283 million followers that the Democrat would get her vote in the US election.
summary: Soon after Kamala Harris finished debating her rival Donald Trump on Tuesday, Taylor Swift told her 283 million followers that the Democrat would get her vote in the US election.

title: Biden Sports Trump Hat At 9/11 Event, White House Calls It A Show Of "Unity"
content: US President Joe Biden was dared to put on adversary Donald Trump's signature red hat as he attended commemorative events with Vice President Kamala Harris.
summary: US President Joe Biden was dared to put on adversary Donald Trump's signature red hat as he attended commemorative events with Vice President Kamala Harris.

title: Hours After Fiery Debate, Trump And Kamala Harris Attend 9/11 Memorial
content: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump shook hands Wednesday at New York's 9/11 memorial to mark the anniversary of the attacks, briefly putting politics aside hours after they clashed in a fiery presidential debate.
summary: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump shook hands Wednesday at New York's 9/11 memorial to mark the anniversary of the attacks, briefly putting politics aside hours after they clashed in a fiery presidential debate.

title: SpaceX Astronauts Set For First Private Spacewalk
content: A group of private astronauts is set to carry out the first private spacewalk in orbit on Thursday from a SpaceX capsule, testing a new line of spacesuits.
summary: A group of private astronauts is set to carry out the first private spacewalk in orbit on Thursday from a SpaceX capsule, testing a new line of spacesuits.

title: North Korea Fires Multiple Short-Range Ballistic Missiles: South Korea
content: North Korea fired multiple short range ballistic missiles into waters east of the Korean peninsula Thursday, Seoul's military reported, days after the nuclear-armed North marked a state anniversary.
summary: North Korea fired multiple short range ballistic missiles into waters east of the Korean peninsula Thursday, Seoul's military reported, days after the nuclear-armed North marked a state anniversary.

title: Ex-CIA Officer Gets 10 Years In Prison For Spying For China
content: A former CIA officer was sentenced on Wednesday to 10 years in prison after pleaded guilty to spying for China, the U.S. Justice Department said.
summary: A former CIA officer was sentenced on Wednesday to 10 years in prison after pleaded guilty to spying for China, the U.S. Justice Department said.

title: Hamas Says Ready To Implement Ceasefire Without New Conditions
content: The Palestinian Hamas group said on Wednesday that its negotiators reiterated its readiness to implement an "immediate" ceasefire with Israel in Gaza based on a previous U.S. proposal without new conditions from any party.
summary: The Palestinian Hamas group said on Wednesday that its negotiators reiterated its readiness to implement an "immediate" ceasefire with Israel in Gaza based on a previous U.S. proposal without new conditions from any party.

title: "We Don't Eat Cats And Dogs": Germany After Trump's Pet-Eating Remarks
content: Germany's foreign ministry mocked US Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump's false assertion about immigrants eating pets in a post on the social platform X on Wednesday while pushing back against his criticism of German energy policy.
summary: Germany's foreign ministry mocked US Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump's false assertion about immigrants eating pets in a post on the social platform X on Wednesday while pushing back against his criticism of German energy policy.

title: Iran Says It Didn't Deliver Missiles To Russia After Western Sanctions
content: Iran's foreign minister said on Wednesday that Tehran had not delivered any ballistic missiles to Russia and sanctions imposed on Iran by the United States and three European powers would not solve any problems between them.
summary: Iran's foreign minister said on Wednesday that Tehran had not delivered any ballistic missiles to Russia and sanctions imposed on Iran by the United States and three European powers would not solve any problems between them.

title: Ajit Doval In Moscow With Ukraine Peace Plan, S Jaishankar Says, "India Ready To..."
content: Russia and Ukraine will have to resolve their conflict by negotiating off the battlefield and India is willing to advise them, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has said.
summary: Russia and Ukraine will have to resolve their conflict by negotiating off the battlefield and India is willing to advise them, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has said.

title: Israel Army Says 2 Soldiers Killed In Gaza Helicopter Crash
content: The Israeli military said Wednesday that an army helicopter crashed in the south of war-ravaged Gaza overnight, killing two soldiers and injuring seven.
summary: The Israeli military said Wednesday that an army helicopter crashed in the south of war-ravaged Gaza overnight, killing two soldiers and injuring seven.

title: Gaza Carpenter Crafts Wooden Sandals For Daughters As War Rages
content: Twelve-year-old Heba Dawas lost her footwear in the chaos while fleeing Israel's military offensive in Gaza. So her carpenter father made wooden-soled sandals for her so she can tread more safely through the tonnes of rubble.
summary: Twelve-year-old Heba Dawas lost her footwear in the chaos while fleeing Israel's military offensive in Gaza. So her carpenter father made wooden-soled sandals for her so she can tread more safely through the tonnes of rubble.

title: Astronomers Spot Imminent Collision Of Black Holes in Nearby Galaxy
content: Astronomers have detected two closely spaced supermassive black holes in the galaxy MCG-03-34-64, located 800 million light-years away.
summary: Astronomers have detected two closely spaced supermassive black holes in the galaxy MCG-03-34-64, located 800 million light-years away.

title: Kamala Harris, Donald Trump Shake Hands At 9/11 Memorial After Fiery Debate
content: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump shook hands Wednesday at New York's 9/11 memorial to mark the anniversary of the attacks, hours after they clashed in a combustible TV debate.
summary: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump shook hands Wednesday at New York's 9/11 memorial to mark the anniversary of the attacks, hours after they clashed in a combustible TV debate.

title: S Jaishankar Calls On German Chancellor, Conveys Personal Greetings Of PM
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Wednesday called on German Chancellor Olaf Scholz in Berlin and conveyed the personal greetings of Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
summary: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Wednesday called on German Chancellor Olaf Scholz in Berlin and conveyed the personal greetings of Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: World's Second Tallest Building To Feature The Highest Nightclub
content: Burj Azizi, set to become the world's second-tallest skyscraper at 725 meters, will feature the highest nightclub on level 126 and a seven-star all-suite hotel celebrating global cultures.
summary: Burj Azizi, set to become the world's second-tallest skyscraper at 725 meters, will feature the highest nightclub on level 126 and a seven-star all-suite hotel celebrating global cultures.

title: US Wants To Build "Best Friends Forever Relationship" With India: Envoy
content: The US wants to build a "BFF (best friends forever) relationship" with India, and a change of guard at the White House will not change ties between the two countries, US Ambassador Eric Garcetti said on Wednesday.
summary: The US wants to build a "BFF (best friends forever) relationship" with India, and a change of guard at the White House will not change ties between the two countries, US Ambassador Eric Garcetti said on Wednesday.

title: Want Good Ties With India But On Basis Of "Fairness": Muhammad Yunus
content: Bangladesh's Chief Adviser Dr Muhammad Yunus on Wednesday said his country wants good relations with India and other neighbouring nations it should be on the basis of "fairness and equality".
summary: Bangladesh's Chief Adviser Dr Muhammad Yunus on Wednesday said his country wants good relations with India and other neighbouring nations it should be on the basis of "fairness and equality".

title: 23 Years After 9/11 Attacks: US War On Terror And How It Changed The World
content: From the moment the first flight took off to the crash of Flight 93, in just two hours, the US was shaken to its core. The attack orchestrated by Osama Bin- laden's Al Qaeda killed 3,000 people.
summary: From the moment the first flight took off to the crash of Flight 93, in just two hours, the US was shaken to its core. The attack orchestrated by Osama Bin- laden's Al Qaeda killed 3,000 people.

title: Kamala Harris Beats Donald Trump 63%-37%, Post-Debate Survey Suggests
content: American voters broadly agree that Vice President Kamala Harris outperformed Donald Trump during Tuesday's presidential debate, according to a CNN poll of debate watchers conducted by SSRS, an independent research firm.
summary: American voters broadly agree that Vice President Kamala Harris outperformed Donald Trump during Tuesday's presidential debate, according to a CNN poll of debate watchers conducted by SSRS, an independent research firm.
